channel.title: Centralization?
channel.description: Has anyone made an effort to standardize/centralize server emulators? A shared login or chat server maybe? How about a useful friends network? Would people even care enough to add support for such a thing to their servers? Would anyone be able to reliably host something like that?

item.title: Centralization?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:10, topic:4174”]That’s what I’m hoping too. Just started looking at my server and client again earlier today. Fixed real chat support, which for some reason gave me a lot of trouble once and was the reason I changed projects…go figure. Still need to code a full-fledged multiplayer system though. What was wrong with your walking?[/quote]it looked like crap and still faced north atm im now using that direction method i posted in the rs2 section, its hawt. tonight ill hopefully figure out my update block so updating the players’ appearance is glitchy.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

frank_:

well…i finally started my holidays, and i decided to overhaul the walking system…so now its lying in pieces and ive temporarily given up hopefully ill get into one of my “smart” moods and have a brainstorm lol.

That’s what I’m hoping too. Just started looking at my server and client again earlier today. Fixed real chat support, which for some reason gave me a lot of trouble once and was the reason I changed projects…go figure. Still need to code a full-fledged multiplayer system though. What was wrong with your walking?

item.title: Centralization?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

frank_:

dont give them ideas Krichevskoy, thats what i plan to do with my rsc =D

lol idea stealer :eek:
I’ve got something similar for my rsc - it’s just that I’m probably never going to finish it, so I thought maybe emuRS2land would be interested. How are you coming with that anyway?

As for SilabNet, yeah, that’s cool - you could use IRC but then you have to deal with it actually being an open IRC channel instead of a custom thing you can control/authenticate as you please. With a projected load that low you could probably even add some nice encryption to everything and not suffer (why encrypt RS chat? because we can).

Have you ever thought of adding friendlist support that could tie in with the client? If I remember correctly, the RS2 F/I-list data consist of lists of username-as-long-int’s that can easily be created by any program (everyone’s seen Jagex’s encoding by now right?). It’s simple to store them locally in a SQL database - if management ease is more of a concern than speed - or in some text/binary format otherwise.

Read full topic

@frank wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:5, topic:4174”]no its a big pain to link irc chat to the ingame client that was my first idea which is why i just ended up writing my own server[/quote]OMG cheese is stealing my ideas!

silab, it would be better, in my opinion, to use irc for your servers to communicate rather than make some icky server and deal with sockets.

item.title: Centralization?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

You could always have the client connect to an IRC server and go on a channel.
Not too hard. Just a new thread with a socket and a few methods on it =P
